1.text: How will the gold become dim the good gold will be changed the stones of the holy place shall be poured out in the head of all the streets.

2.text: The precious sons of Zion being lifted up with fine gold, how they were reckoned for earthen vessels, the work of the hands of the potter.

3.text: Also the dragons draw out the breast, they suckled their sucklings: the daughter of my people violent as the ostriches in the desert.

4.text: The tongue of the suckling adhered to his palate in thirst: the young children asked for bread, none breaking bread to them.

5.text: They eating for dainties were desolate in the streets: they trusting upon scarlet embraced dung hills.

6.text: For the iniquity of the daughter of my people will be great above the sin of Sodom being overthrown as in a moment, and no hands waited for her.

7.text: Her consecrated ones were pure above snow, they were white above milk, they were red of body above pearls, their figure sapphire:

8.text: Their form dark above blackness; they were not known in the streets: their skin adhered to their bones; it was dried up, it was as wood.

9.text: Those wounded by the sword were good above those wounded by famine: these will flow away, being thrust through from the produce of the field.

10.text: The hands of compassionate women boiled their children: they were for food to them in the breaking of the daughter of my people.

11.text: Jehovah finished his wrath; he poured out the burning of his anger, and he kindled a fire in Zion, and it will devour her foundations.

12.text: The kings of the earth believed not, and all those dwelling in the habitable globe, that the enemy will come in to the gates of Jerusalem.

13.text: From the sins of her prophets the iniquities of her priests shedding the blood of the just in her midst,

14.text: The blind were shaken in the streets, they were stained with blood, so that they shall not be able to touch upon their garments.

15.text: Remove the unclean one, call to them; remove, remove, ye shall not touch: for they were laid waste; they were shaken, say ye, among the nations: they shall not add to sojourn.

16.text: The face of Jehovah their portion; he will not add to look upon them: they accepted not the face of the priests, they compassionated not the old men.

17.text: Continuing, yet our eyes will fail, for our help in vain: in our watching we watched for a nation it will not save us.

18.text: They hunted our steps from going in our broad places: our end drew near, our days were completed; for our end came.

19.text: They pursuing us were swift above the eagle of the heavens: they burned after us upon the mountains, they laid wait for us in the desert.

20.text: The spirit of our nostrils, the Messiah of Jehovah was taken in their pits, of whom we said, Under his shadow we shall live among the nations.

21.text: Rejoice and be glad, O daughter of Edom, dwelling in the land of Uz; also upon thee shall the cup pass: thou shalt be drunken, and make thyself naked.

22.text: Thine iniquity was finished, O daughter of Zion; he will not add to carry thee into exile: reviewing thine iniquity, O daughter of Edom, he uncovered upon thy sins.
